3435       * Same as {@link #useJavaBeanIntrospector()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.

3438       * @return This object.
3439       */
3440      @FluentSetter

3442         useJavaBeanIntrospector = value;
3443         return this;

3504      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3505      // Helpers
3506      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3507
3508      private static Set<Class<?>> classSet() {
3509         return new TreeSet<>(Comparator.comparing(Class::getName));
3510      }
3511
3512      private static Set<Class<?>> classSet(Collection<Class<?>> copy) {
3513         return classSet(copy, false);
3514      }
3515
3516      private static Set<Class<?>> classSet(Collection<Class<?>> copy, boolean nullIfEmpty) {
3517         if (copy == null || (nullIfEmpty && copy.isEmpty()))
3518            return null;
3519         Set<Class<?>> x = classSet();
3520         x.addAll(copy);
3521         return x;
3522      }
3523   }

3528
3529   final boolean
3530      beansRequireDefaultConstructor,
3531      beansRequireSerializable,
3532      beansRequireSettersForGetters,
3533      beansRequireSomeProperties,
3534      beanMapPutReturnsOldValue,
3535      useInterfaceProxies,
3536      ignoreUnknownBeanProperties,
3537      ignoreUnknownNullBeanProperties,
3538      ignoreUnknownEnumValues,
3539      ignoreMissingSetters,
3540      ignoreTransientFields,
3541      ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnGetters,
3542      ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnSetters,
3543      useJavaBeanIntrospector,
3544      useEnumNames,
3545      sortProperties,
3546      findFluentSetters;
3547   final Visibility
3548      beanConstructorVisibility,
3549      beanClassVisibility,
3550      beanMethodVisibility,
3551      beanFieldVisibility;
3552   final String typePropertyName;
3553   final Locale locale;
3554   final TimeZone timeZone;
3555   final MediaType mediaType;
3556   final Class<? extends PropertyNamer> propertyNamer;
3557   final List<Class<?>> beanDictionary, notBeanClasses;
3558   final List<Object> swaps;
3559   final List<String> notBeanPackages;
3560   final HashKey hashKey;
3561
3562   final Map<Class,ClassMeta> cmCache;
3563
3564   private final String[] notBeanPackageNames, notBeanPackagePrefixes;
3565   private final BeanRegistry beanRegistry;
3566   private final PropertyNamer propertyNamerBean;
3567   private final ObjectSwap[] swapArray;
3568   private final Class<?>[] notBeanClassesArray;
3569   private final ClassMeta<Object> cmObject;  // Reusable ClassMeta that represents general Objects.
3570   private final ClassMeta<String> cmString;  // Reusable ClassMeta that represents general Strings.
3571   private final ClassMeta<Class> cmClass;  // Reusable ClassMeta that represents general Classes.
3572
3573   private final BeanSession defaultSession;
3574   private volatile WriterSerializer beanToStringSerializer;
3575
3576   /**
3577    * Constructor.
3578    *
3579    * @param builder The builder for this object.
3580    */
3581   public BeanContext(Builder builder) {
3582      super(builder);
3583
3584      hashKey = builder.hashKey();
3585
3586      beanConstructorVisibility = builder.beanConstructorVisibility;
3587      beanClassVisibility = builder.beanClassVisibility;
3588      beanMethodVisibility = builder.beanMethodVisibility;
3589      beanFieldVisibility = builder.beanFieldVisibility;
3590      beansRequireDefaultConstructor = builder.beansRequireDefaultConstructor;
3591      beansRequireSerializable = builder.beansRequireSerializable;
3592      beansRequireSettersForGetters = builder.beansRequireSettersForGetters;
3593      beansRequireSomeProperties = ! builder.disableBeansRequireSomeProperties;
3594      beanMapPutReturnsOldValue = builder.beanMapPutReturnsOldValue;
3595      useEnumNames = builder.useEnumNames;
3596      useInterfaceProxies = ! builder.disableInterfaceProxies;
3597      ignoreUnknownBeanProperties = builder.ignoreUnknownBeanProperties;
3598      ignoreUnknownNullBeanProperties = ! builder.disableIgnoreUnknownNullBeanProperties;
3599      ignoreUnknownEnumValues = builder.ignoreUnknownEnumValues;
3600      ignoreMissingSetters = ! builder.disableIgnoreMissingSetters;
3601      ignoreTransientFields = ! builder.disableIgnoreTransientFields;
3602      ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnGetters = builder.ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnGetters;
3603      ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnSetters = builder.ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnSetters;
3604      useJavaBeanIntrospector = builder.useJavaBeanIntrospector;
3605      sortProperties = builder.sortProperties;
3606      findFluentSetters = builder.findFluentSetters;
3607      typePropertyName = builder.typePropertyName != null ? builder.typePropertyName : "_type";
3608      locale = builder.locale != null ? builder.locale : Locale.getDefault();
3609      timeZone = builder.timeZone;
3610      mediaType = builder.mediaType;
3611      beanDictionary = opt(builder.beanDictionary).map(Collections::unmodifiableList).orElse(list());
3612      swaps = opt(builder.swaps).map(Collections::unmodifiableList).orElse(list());
3613      notBeanClasses = opt(builder.notBeanClasses).map(ArrayList::new).map(Collections::unmodifiableList).orElse(list());
3614      notBeanPackages = opt(builder.notBeanPackages).map(ArrayList::new).map(Collections::unmodifiableList).orElse(list());
3615      propertyNamer = builder.propertyNamer != null ? builder.propertyNamer : BasicPropertyNamer.class;
3616
3617      notBeanClassesArray = notBeanClasses.isEmpty() ? DEFAULT_NOTBEAN_CLASSES : Stream.of(notBeanClasses, alist(DEFAULT_NOTBEAN_CLASSES)).flatMap(Collection::stream).toArray(Class[]::new);
3618
3619      String[] _notBeanPackages = notBeanPackages.isEmpty() ? DEFAULT_NOTBEAN_PACKAGES : Stream.of(notBeanPackages, alist(DEFAULT_NOTBEAN_PACKAGES)).flatMap(Collection::stream).toArray(String[]::new);
3620      notBeanPackageNames = Stream.of(_notBeanPackages).filter(x -> ! x.endsWith(".*")).toArray(String[]::new);
3621      notBeanPackagePrefixes = Stream.of(_notBeanPackages).filter(x -> x.endsWith(".*")).map(x -> x.substring(0, x.length()-2)).toArray(String[]::new);
3622
3623      try {
3624         propertyNamerBean = propertyNamer.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
3625      } catch (Exception e) {
3626         throw asRuntimeException(e);
3627      }
3628
3629      LinkedList<ObjectSwap<?,?>> _swaps = new LinkedList<>();
3630      swaps.forEach(x -> {
3631         if (x instanceof ObjectSwap) {
3632            _swaps.add((ObjectSwap<?,?>)x);
3633         } else {
3634            ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of((Class<?>)x);
3635            if (ci.isChildOf(ObjectSwap.class))
3636               _swaps.add(BeanCreator.of(ObjectSwap.class).type(ci).run());
3637            else if (ci.isChildOf(Surrogate.class))
3638               _swaps.addAll(SurrogateSwap.findObjectSwaps(ci.inner(), this));
3639            else
3640               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid class {0} specified in BeanContext.swaps property.  Must be a subclass of ObjectSwap or Surrogate.", ci.inner());
3641         }
3642      });
3643      swapArray = _swaps.toArray(new ObjectSwap[_swaps.size()]);
3644
3645      cmCache = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
3646      cmCache.put(String.class, new ClassMeta(String.class, this, findObjectSwaps(String.class), findChildObjectSwaps(String.class)));
3647      cmCache.put(Object.class, new ClassMeta(Object.class, this, findObjectSwaps(Object.class), findChildObjectSwaps(Object.class)));
3648      cmString = cmCache.get(String.class);
3649      cmObject = cmCache.get(Object.class);
3650      cmClass = cmCache.get(Class.class);
3651
3652      beanRegistry = new BeanRegistry(this, null);
3653      defaultSession = createSession().unmodifiable().build();
3654   }
3655
3656   @Override /* Context */
3657   public Builder copy() {
3658      return new Builder(this);
3659   }
3660
3661   @Override /* Context */
3662   public BeanSession.Builder createSession() {
3663      return BeanSession.create(this);
3664   }
3665
3666   @Override /* Context */
3667   public BeanSession getSession() {
3668      return defaultSession;
3669   }
3670
3671   /**
3672    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified bean context shares the same cache as this bean context.
3673    *
3674    * <p>
3675    * Useful for testing purposes.
3676    *
3677    * @param bc The bean context to compare to.
3678    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the bean contexts have equivalent settings and thus share caches.
3679    */
3680   public final boolean hasSameCache(BeanContext bc) {
3681      return bc.cmCache == this.cmCache;
3682   }
3683
3684   /**
3685    * Wraps an object inside a {@link BeanMap} object (a modifiable {@link Map}).
3686    *
3687    * <p>
3688    * This is a shortcut for the following code:  <c>createSession().build().toBeanMap(<jv>object</jv>);</c>
3689    *
3690    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
3691    * <p class='bjava'>
3692    *    <jc>// Construct a bean map around a bean instance</jc>
3693    *    BeanMap&lt;Person&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toBeanMap(<jk>new</jk> Person());
3694    * </p>
3695    *
3696    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
3697    * @param object The object to wrap in a map interface.  Must not be null.
3698    * @return The wrapped object.
3699    * @see BeanSession#toBeanMap(Object)
3700    */
3701   public <T> BeanMap<T> toBeanMap(T object) {
3702      return defaultSession.toBeanMap(object);
3703   }
3704
3705   /**
3706    * Creates a new {@link BeanMap} object (a modifiable {@link Map}) of the given class with uninitialized
3707    * property values.
3708    *
3709    * <p>
3710    * This is a shortcut for the following code:  <c>createSession().build().newBeanMap(<jv>_class</jv>);</c>
3711    *
3712    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
3713    * <p class='bjava'>
3714    *    <jc>// Construct a new bean map wrapped around a new Person object</jc>
3715    *    BeanMap&lt;Person&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = BeanContext.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.newBeanMap(Person.<jk>class</jk>);
3716    * </p>
3717    *
3718    * @param <T> The class of the object being wrapped.
3719    * @param c The name of the class to create a new instance of.
3720    * @return A new instance of the class.
3721    * @see BeanSession#newBeanMap(Class)
3722    */
3723   public <T> BeanMap<T> newBeanMap(Class<T> c) {
3724      return defaultSession.newBeanMap(c);
3725   }

3727   /**
3728    * Converts the specified value to the specified class type.
3729    *
3730    * <p>
3731    * This is a shortcut for the following code:  <c>createSession().build().convertToType(<jv>value</jv>, <jv>type</jv>);</c>
3732    *
3733    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
3734    * @param value The value to convert.
3735    * @param type The class type to convert the value to.
3736    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
3737    * @return The converted value.
3738    * @see BeanSession#convertToType(Object, Class)
3739    */
3740   public final <T> T convertToType(Object value, Class<T> type) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
3741      return defaultSession.convertToType(value, type);
3742   }
3743
3744   /**
3745    * Same as {@link #convertToType(Object, Class)}, except used for instantiating inner member classes that must
3746    * be instantiated within another class instance.
3747    *
3748    * <p>
3749    * This is a shortcut for the following code:  <c>createSession().build().convertToMemberType(<jv>outer</jv>, <jv>value</jv>, <jv>type</jv>);</c>
3750    *
3751    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
3752    * @param outer
3753    *    If class is a member class, this is the instance of the containing class.
3754    *    Should be <jk>null</jk> if not a member class.
3755    * @param value The value to convert.
3756    * @param type The class type to convert the value to.
3757    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
3758    * @return The converted value.
3759    * @see BeanSession#convertToMemberType(Object, Object, Class)
3760    */
3761   public final <T> T convertToMemberType(Object outer, Object value, Class<T> type) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
3762      return defaultSession.convertToMemberType(outer, value, getClassMeta(type));
3763   }
3764
3765   /**
3766    * Same as {@link #convertToType(Object, Class)}, but allows for complex data types consisting of collections or maps.
3767    *
3768    * <p>
3769    * This is a shortcut for the following code:  <c>createSession().build().convertToType(<jv>value</jv>, <jv>type</jv>, <jv>args</jv>);</c>
3770    *
3771    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
3772    * @param value The value to be converted.
3773    * @param type The target object type.
3774    * @param args The target object parameter types.
3775    * @return The converted type.
3776    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
3777    * @see BeanSession#convertToType(Object, Type, Type...)
3778    */
3779   public final <T> T convertToType(Object value, Type type, Type...args) throws InvalidDataConversionException {
3780      return (T)defaultSession.convertToMemberType(null, value, getClassMeta(type, args));
3781   }
3782
3783   /**
3784    * Determines whether the specified class is ignored as a bean class based on the various exclusion parameters
3785    * specified on this context class.
3786    *
3787    * @param c The class type being tested.
3788    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified class matches any of the exclusion parameters.
3789    */
3790   protected final boolean isNotABean(Class<?> c) {
3791      if (c.isArray() || c.isPrimitive() || c.isEnum() || c.isAnnotation())
3792         return true;
3793      Package p = c.getPackage();
3794      if (p != null) {
3795         for (String p2 : notBeanPackageNames)
3796            if (p.getName().equals(p2))
3797               return true;
3798         for (String p2 : notBeanPackagePrefixes)
3799            if (p.getName().startsWith(p2))
3800               return true;
3801      }
3802      ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(c);
3803      for (Class exclude : notBeanClassesArray)
3804         if (ci.isChildOf(exclude))
3805            return true;
3806      return false;
3807   }
3808
3809   /**
3810    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is a bean.
3811    *
3812    * @param o The object to test.
3813    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is a bean.  <jk>false</jk> if the bean is <jk>null</jk>.
3814    */
3815   public boolean isBean(Object o) {
3816      if (o == null)
3817         return false;
3818      return getClassMetaForObject(o).isBean();
3819   }
3820
3821   /**
3822    * Returns the {@link BeanMeta} class for the specified class.
3823    *
3824    * @param <T> The class type to get the meta-data on.
3825    * @param c The class to get the meta-data on.
3826    * @return
3827    *    The {@link BeanMeta} for the specified class, or <jk>null</jk> if the class is not a bean per the settings on
3828    *    this context.
3829    */
3830   public final <T> BeanMeta<T> getBeanMeta(Class<T> c) {
3831      if (c == null)
3832         return null;
3833      return getClassMeta(c).getBeanMeta();
3834   }
3835
3836   /**
3837    * Construct a {@code ClassMeta} wrapper around a {@link Class} object.
3838    *
3839    * @param <T> The class type being wrapped.
3840    * @param type The class to resolve.
3841    * @return
3842    *    If the class is not an array, returns a cached {@link ClassMeta} object.
3843    *    Otherwise, returns a new {@link ClassMeta} object every time.
3844    */
3845   public final <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Class<T> type) {
3846      return getClassMeta(type, true);
3847   }
3848
3849   /**
3850    * Construct a {@code ClassMeta} wrapper around a {@link Class} object.
3851    *
3852    * @param <T> The class type being wrapped.
3853    * @param type The class to resolve.
3854    * @param waitForInit
3855    *    When enabled, wait for the ClassMeta constructor to finish before returning.
3856    * @return
3857    *    If the class is not an array, returns a cached {@link ClassMeta} object.
3858    *    Otherwise, returns a new {@link ClassMeta} object every time.
3859    */
3860   final <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Class<T> type, boolean waitForInit) {
3861
3862      // This can happen if we have transforms defined against String or Object.
3863      if (cmCache == null)
3864         return null;
3865
3866      ClassMeta<T> cm = cmCache.get(type);
3867      if (cm == null) {
3868
3869         synchronized (this) {
3870            // Make sure someone didn't already set it while this thread was blocked.
3871            cm = cmCache.get(type);
3872            if (cm == null)
3873               cm = new ClassMeta<>(type, this, findObjectSwaps(type), findChildObjectSwaps(type));
3874         }
3875      }
3876      if (waitForInit)
3877         cm.waitForInit();
3878      return cm;
3879   }
3880
3881   /**
3882    * Used to resolve <c>ClassMetas</c> of type <c>Collection</c> and <c>Map</c> that have
3883    * <c>ClassMeta</c> values that themselves could be collections or maps.
3884    *
3885    * <p>
3886    * <c>Collection</c> meta objects are assumed to be followed by zero or one meta objects indicating the element type.
3887    *
3888    * <p>
3889    * <c>Map</c> meta objects are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value types.
3890    *
3891    * <p>
3892    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
3893    *
3894    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
3895    * <ul>
3896    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A normal type.
3897    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(List.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A list containing objects.
3898    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(List.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A list containing strings.
3899    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A linked-list containing
3900    *       strings.
3901    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> -
3902    *       A linked-list containing linked-lists of strings.
3903    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(Map.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A map containing object keys/values.
3904    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(Map.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);</code> - A map
3905    *       containing string keys/values.
3906    *    <li><code>getClassMeta(Map.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);</code> -
3907    *       A map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.
3908    * </ul>
3909    *
3910    * @param <T>
3911    *    The class to resolve.
3912    * @param type
3913    *    The class to resolve.
3914    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
3915    * @param args
3916    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
3917    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
3918    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
3919    * @return The resolved class meta.
3920    */
3921   public final <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta(Type type, Type...args) {
3922      if (type == null)
3923         return null;
3924      ClassMeta<T> cm = type instanceof Class ? getClassMeta((Class)type) : resolveClassMeta(type, null);
3925      if (args.length == 0)
3926         return cm;
3927      ClassMeta<?>[] cma = new ClassMeta[args.length+1];
3928      cma[0] = cm;
3929      for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(args); i++) {
3930         Type arg = (Type)Array.get(args, i);
3931         cma[i+1] = arg instanceof Class ? getClassMeta((Class)arg) : resolveClassMeta(arg, null);
3932      }
3933      return (ClassMeta<T>) getTypedClassMeta(cma, 0);
3934   }
3935
3936   /*
3937    * Resolves the 'genericized' class meta at the specified position in the ClassMeta array.
3938    */
3939   private ClassMeta<?> getTypedClassMeta(ClassMeta<?>[] c, int pos) {
3940      ClassMeta<?> cm = c[pos++];
3941      if (cm.isCollection() || cm.isOptional()) {
3942         ClassMeta<?> ce = c.length == pos ? object() : getTypedClassMeta(c, pos);
3943         return (ce.isObject() ? cm : new ClassMeta(cm, null, null, ce));
3944      } else if (cm.isMap()) {
3945         ClassMeta<?> ck = c.length == pos ? object() : c[pos++];
3946         ClassMeta<?> cv = c.length == pos ? object() : getTypedClassMeta(c, pos);
3947         return (ck.isObject() && cv.isObject() ? cm : new ClassMeta(cm, ck, cv, null));
3948      }
3949      return cm;
3950   }
3951
3952   final ClassMeta resolveClassMeta(Type o, Map<Class<?>,Class<?>[]> typeVarImpls) {
3953      if (o == null)
3954         return null;
3955
3956      if (o instanceof ClassMeta) {
3957         ClassMeta<?> cm = (ClassMeta)o;
3958
3959         // This classmeta could have been created by a different context.
3960         // Need to re-resolve it to pick up ObjectSwaps and stuff on this context.
3961         if (cm.getBeanContext() == this)
3962            return cm;
3963         if (cm.isMap())
3964            return getClassMeta(cm.innerClass, cm.getKeyType(), cm.getValueType());
3965         if (cm.isCollection() || cm.isOptional())
3966            return getClassMeta(cm.innerClass, cm.getElementType());
3967         return getClassMeta(cm.innerClass);
3968      }
3969
3970      Class c = resolve(o, typeVarImpls);
3971
3972      // This can happen when trying to resolve the "E getFirst()" method on LinkedList, whose type is a TypeVariable
3973      // These should just resolve to Object.
3974      if (c == null)
3975         return object();
3976
3977      ClassMeta rawType = getClassMeta(c);
3978
3979      // If this is a Map or Collection, and the parameter types aren't part
3980      // of the class definition itself (e.g. class AddressBook extends List<Person>),
3981      // then we need to figure out the parameters.
3982      if (rawType.isMap() || rawType.isCollection() || rawType.isOptional()) {
3983         ClassMeta[] params = findParameters(o, c);
3984         if (params == null)
3985            return rawType;
3986         if (rawType.isMap()) {
3987            if (params.length != 2 || (params[0].isObject() && params[1].isObject()))
3988               return rawType;
3989            return new ClassMeta(rawType, params[0], params[1], null);
3990         }
3991         if (rawType.isCollection() || rawType.isOptional()) {
3992            if (params.length != 1 || params[0].isObject())
3993               return rawType;
3994            return new ClassMeta(rawType, null, null, params[0]);
3995         }
3996      }
3997
3998      if (rawType.isArray()) {
3999         if (o instanceof GenericArrayType) {
4000            GenericArrayType gat = (GenericArrayType)o;
4001            ClassMeta elementType = resolveClassMeta(gat.getGenericComponentType(), typeVarImpls);
4002            return new ClassMeta(rawType, null, null, elementType);
4003         }
4004      }
4005
4006      return rawType;
4007   }
4008
4009   /**
4010    * Convert a Type to a Class if possible.
4011    * Return null if not possible.
4012    */
4013   final Class resolve(Type t, Map<Class<?>,Class<?>[]> typeVarImpls) {
4014
4015      if (t instanceof Class)
4016         return (Class)t;
4017
4018      if (t instanceof ParameterizedType)
4019         // A parameter (e.g. <String>.
4020         return (Class)((ParameterizedType)t).getRawType();
4021
4022      if (t instanceof GenericArrayType) {
4023         // An array parameter (e.g. <byte[]>).
4024         Type gatct = ((GenericArrayType)t).getGenericComponentType();
4025
4026         if (gatct instanceof Class)
4027            return Array.newInstance((Class)gatct, 0).getClass();
4028
4029         if (gatct instanceof ParameterizedType)
4030            return Array.newInstance((Class)((ParameterizedType)gatct).getRawType(), 0).getClass();
4031
4032         if (gatct instanceof GenericArrayType)
4033            return Array.newInstance(resolve(gatct, typeVarImpls), 0).getClass();
4034
4035         return null;
4036
4037      } else if (t instanceof TypeVariable) {
4038         if (typeVarImpls != null) {
4039            TypeVariable tv = (TypeVariable)t;
4040            String varName = tv.getName();
4041            int varIndex = -1;
4042            Class gc = (Class)tv.getGenericDeclaration();
4043            TypeVariable[] tvv = gc.getTypeParameters();
4044            for (int i = 0; i < tvv.length; i++) {
4045               if (tvv[i].getName().equals(varName)) {
4046                  varIndex = i;
4047               }
4048            }
4049            if (varIndex != -1) {
4050
4051               // If we couldn't find a type variable implementation, that means
4052               // the type was defined at runtime (e.g. Bean b = new Bean<Foo>();)
4053               // in which case the type is lost through erasure.
4054               // Assume java.lang.Object as the type.
4055               if (! typeVarImpls.containsKey(gc))
4056                  return null;
4057
4058               return typeVarImpls.get(gc)[varIndex];
4059            }
4060         }
4061      }
4062      return null;
4063   }
4064
4065   final ClassMeta[] findParameters(Type o, Class c) {
4066      if (o == null)
4067         o = c;
4068
4069      // Loop until we find a ParameterizedType
4070      if (! (o instanceof ParameterizedType)) {
4071         loop: do {
4072            o = c.getGenericSuperclass();
4073            if (o instanceof ParameterizedType)
4074               break loop;
4075            for (Type t : c.getGenericInterfaces()) {
4076               o = t;
4077               if (o instanceof ParameterizedType)
4078                  break loop;
4079            }
4080            c = c.getSuperclass();
4081         } while (c != null);
4082      }
4083
4084      if (o instanceof ParameterizedType) {
4085         ParameterizedType pt = (ParameterizedType)o;
4086         if (! pt.getRawType().equals(Enum.class)) {
4087            List<ClassMeta<?>> l = new LinkedList<>();
4088            for (Type pt2 : pt.getActualTypeArguments()) {
4089               if (pt2 instanceof WildcardType || pt2 instanceof TypeVariable)
4090                  return null;
4091               l.add(resolveClassMeta(pt2, null));
4092            }
4093            if (l.isEmpty())
4094               return null;
4095            return l.toArray(new ClassMeta[l.size()]);
4096         }
4097      }
4098
4099      return null;
4100   }
4101
4102   /**
4103    * Shortcut for calling {@code getClassMeta(o.getClass())}.
4104    *
4105    * @param <T> The class of the object being passed in.
4106    * @param o The class to find the class type for.
4107    * @return The ClassMeta object, or <jk>null</jk> if {@code o} is <jk>null</jk>.
4108    */
4109   public final <T> ClassMeta<T> getClassMetaForObject(T o) {
4110      if (o == null)
4111         return null;
4112      return (ClassMeta<T>)getClassMeta(o.getClass());
4113   }
4114
4115
4116   /**
4117    * Used for determining the class type on a method or field where a {@code @Beanp} annotation may be present.
4118    *
4119    * @param <T> The class type we're wrapping.
4120    * @param p The property annotation on the type if there is one.
4121    * @param t The type.
4122    * @param typeVarImpls
4123    *    Contains known resolved type parameters on the specified class so that we can result
4124    *    {@code ParameterizedTypes} and {@code TypeVariables}.
4125    *    Can be <jk>null</jk> if the information is not known.
4126    * @return The new {@code ClassMeta} object wrapped around the {@code Type} object.
4127    */
4128   protected final <T> ClassMeta<T> resolveClassMeta(Beanp p, Type t, Map<Class<?>,Class<?>[]> typeVarImpls) {
4129      ClassMeta<T> cm = resolveClassMeta(t, typeVarImpls);
4130      ClassMeta<T> cm2 = cm;
4131
4132      if (p != null) {
4133
4134         if (isNotVoid(p.type()))
4135            cm2 = resolveClassMeta(p.type(), typeVarImpls);
4136
4137         if (cm2.isMap()) {
4138            Class<?>[] pParams = (p.params().length == 0 ? new Class[]{Object.class, Object.class} : p.params());
4139            if (pParams.length != 2)
4140               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid number of parameters specified for Map (must be 2): {0}", pParams.length);
4141            ClassMeta<?> keyType = resolveType(pParams[0], cm2.getKeyType(), cm.getKeyType());
4142            ClassMeta<?> valueType = resolveType(pParams[1], cm2.getValueType(), cm.getValueType());
4143            if (keyType.isObject() && valueType.isObject())
4144               return cm2;
4145            return new ClassMeta<>(cm2, keyType, valueType, null);
4146         }
4147
4148         if (cm2.isCollection() || cm2.isOptional()) {
4149            Class<?>[] pParams = (p.params().length == 0 ? new Class[]{Object.class} : p.params());
4150            if (pParams.length != 1)
4151               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid number of parameters specified for {1} (must be 1): {0}", pParams.length, (cm2.isCollection() ? "Collection" : cm2.isOptional() ? "Optional" : "Array"));
4152            ClassMeta<?> elementType = resolveType(pParams[0], cm2.getElementType(), cm.getElementType());
4153            if (elementType.isObject())
4154               return cm2;
4155            return new ClassMeta<>(cm2, null, null, elementType);
4156         }
4157
4158         return cm2;
4159      }
4160
4161      return cm;
4162   }
4163
4164   private ClassMeta<?> resolveType(Type...t) {
4165      for (Type tt : t) {
4166         if (tt != null) {
4167            ClassMeta<?> cm = getClassMeta(tt);
4168            if (tt != cmObject)
4169               return cm;
4170         }
4171      }
4172      return cmObject;
4173   }
4174
4175   /**
4176    * Returns the {@link ObjectSwap} associated with the specified class, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no POJO swap
4177    * associated with the class.
4178    *
4179    * @param <T> The class associated with the swap.
4180    * @param c The class associated with the swap.
4181    * @return The swap associated with the class, or null if there is no association.
4182    */
4183   private final <T> ObjectSwap[] findObjectSwaps(Class<T> c) {
4184      // Note:  On first
4185      if (c != null) {
4186         List<ObjectSwap> l = Utils.list();
4187         for (ObjectSwap f : swapArray)
4188            if (f.getNormalClass().isParentOf(c))
4189               l.add(f);
4190         return l.isEmpty() ? null : l.toArray(new ObjectSwap[l.size()]);
4191      }
4192      return null;
4193   }
4194
4195   /**
4196    * Checks whether a class has a {@link ObjectSwap} associated with it in this bean context.
4197    *
4198    * @param c The class to check.
4199    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified class or one of its subclasses has a {@link ObjectSwap} associated with it.
4200    */
4201   private final ObjectSwap[] findChildObjectSwaps(Class<?> c) {
4202      if (c == null || swapArray.length == 0)
4203         return null;
4204      List<ObjectSwap> l = null;
4205      for (ObjectSwap f : swapArray) {
4206         if (f.getNormalClass().isChildOf(c)) {
4207            if (l == null)
4208               l = Utils.list();
4209            l.add(f);
4210         }
4211      }
4212      return l == null ? null : l.toArray(new ObjectSwap[l.size()]);
4213   }
4214

4223    * avoid a hashmap lookup.
4224    *
4225    * @return The {@link ClassMeta} object associated with the <c>Object</c> class.
4226    */
4227   protected final ClassMeta<Object> object() {
4228      return cmObject;

4399   public final String getBeanTypePropertyName() {

4627
4628   /**
4629    * Returns the serializer to use for serializing beans when using the {@link BeanSession#convertToType(Object, Class)}
4630    * and related methods.
4631    *
4632    * @return The serializer.  May be <jk>null</jk> if all initialization has occurred.
4633    */
4634   protected WriterSerializer getBeanToStringSerializer() {
4635      if (beanToStringSerializer == null) {
4636         if (JsonSerializer.DEFAULT == null)
4637            return null;
4638         this.beanToStringSerializer = JsonSerializer.create().beanContext(this).sq().simpleAttrs().build();
4639      }
4640      return beanToStringSerializer;
4641   }
4642
4643   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4644   // Other methods
4645   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4646
4647   @Override /* Context */
4648   protected JsonMap properties() {
4649      return filteredMap()
4650         .append("id", System.identityHashCode(this))
4651         .append("beanClassVisibility", beanClassVisibility)
4652         .append("beanConstructorVisibility", beanConstructorVisibility)
4653         .append("beanDictionary", beanDictionary)
4654         .append("beanFieldVisibility", beanFieldVisibility)
4655         .append("beanMethodVisibility", beanMethodVisibility)
4656         .append("beansRequireDefaultConstructor", beansRequireDefaultConstructor)
4657         .append("beansRequireSerializable", beansRequireSerializable)
4658         .append("beansRequireSettersForGetters", beansRequireSettersForGetters)
4659         .append("beansRequireSomeProperties", beansRequireSomeProperties)
4660         .append("ignoreTransientFields", ignoreTransientFields)
4661         .append("ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnGetters", ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnGetters)
4662         .append("ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnSetters", ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnSetters)
4663         .append("ignoreUnknownBeanProperties", ignoreUnknownBeanProperties)
4664         .append("ignoreUnknownNullBeanProperties", ignoreUnknownNullBeanProperties)
4665         .append("notBeanClasses", notBeanClasses)
4666         .append("notBeanPackageNames", notBeanPackageNames)
4667         .append("notBeanPackagePrefixes", notBeanPackagePrefixes)
4668         .append("swaps", swaps)
4669         .append("sortProperties", sortProperties)
4670         .append("useEnumNames", useEnumNames)
4671         .append("useInterfaceProxies", useInterfaceProxies)
4672         .append("useJavaBeanIntrospector", useJavaBeanIntrospector);
4673   }
4674}
